sentences.english: He led them by a straight way to a city where they could settle.
sentences.chinese: 又领他们行走直路，使他们往可居住的城邑。

sentences.english: And Benhadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel;
sentences.chinese: 便哈达听从亚撒王的话，派军长去攻击以色列的城邑。

sentences.english: Jousting Lists improve the quality of knights recruited here.
sentences.chinese: 枪术赛场提高城邑中骑兵部队的作战技巧。

sentences.english: Like a city breached; without walls, is one who lacks self—control.
sentences.chinese: 人不制伏自己的心，好像毁坏的城邑，没有城垣。

sentences.english: An Alchemists ' Guild house notably improves the experience level of gunpowder units trained in the same settlement.
sentences.chinese: 炼金大师行会明显提高城邑中火药部队的作战经验。

sentences.english: He removed the high places and incense altars in every town in Judah, and the kingdom was at peace under him.
sentences.chinese: 又在犹大各城邑除掉丘坛和日像，那时国享太平。

sentences.english: And all their cities, and their villages, and castles, they burned.
sentences.chinese: 火烧了他们所住的一切城邑和营寨。

sentences.english: What kind of towns are these you have given me, my brother?
sentences.chinese: 说，我兄阿，你给我的是什么城邑呢？

sentences.english: Like a city whose walls are broken down is a man who lacks self control .
sentences.chinese: 人不伏制自己的心，好像毁坏的城邑，没有墙垣。

sentences.english: Measures the fertility and barrenness of the earth, to decide where to build cities.
sentences.chinese: 要衡量土地的肥瘠来确定建立城邑。

sentences.english: There were fairly perfect supplies of water and drainages in the cities of Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 商代城邑已具有较完备的给排水设施。

sentences.english: Port allows a settlement to trade with the far-distant corners of the world.
sentences.chinese: 港口令城邑可与世界任何角落进行海路贸易。

sentences.english: And they smote all the cities round about Gerar;
sentences.chinese: 又打破基拉耳四围的城邑。

sentences.english: But as for the Israelites who were living in the towns of Judah, Rehoboam still ruled over them.
sentences.chinese: 惟独住犹大城邑的以色列人，罗波安仍作他们的王。

sentences.english: And upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.
sentences.chinese: 加略，波斯拉，和摩押地远近所有的城邑。

sentences.english: The Alchemists ' Guild Headquarters greatly improves the experience level of gunpowder units trained in the same settlement.
sentences.chinese: 炼金行会总部显著提高城邑中火药部队的作战经验。

definition: grant of territory by an emperor or monarch (old)
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
seat of the principal county magistrate in imperial China
old name for Beijing 北京[Bei3 jing1]
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
